name: Mark-Jan Nederhof
content: Mark-Jan Nederhof Mark-Jan Nederhof Graduated in Computer Science in 1990 at the University of Nijmegen. OIO (PhD-student) at the University of Nijmegen, at the Computer Science Department from 1990 till 1994. From February 1995 till March 1998, post-doc researcher involved in the OVIS-project (Openbaar Vervoer Informatie Systeem), at the department of Humanities Computing of the University of Groningen. From March 1998 till July 2000, senior researcher at DFKI, Saarbr체cken, involved in the Verbmobil-project. From November 1999 till March 2000, on leave from DFKI, consultant at AT&T Shannon Laboratory. From July 2000 till July 2003, KNAW fellowship at the department of Humanities Computing of the University of Groningen. From August 2003 till September 2005, lecturer at the department of Humanities Computing of the University of Groningen, and affiliated to the Pionier project Algorithms for Linguistic Processing. From October 2005 till October 2006, senior researcher at the Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics. From July 2006 till September 2006, on leave from MPI, sabbatical with the Research Group on Mathematical Linguistics at the Rovira i Virgili University. From November 2006, lecturer at the School of Computer Science of the University of St Andrews.
